subject: Relationships
title: Growing Apart: When People Change
description: Learn Growing Apart: When People Change in one minute.

hook.text: You fell in love at 22. By 35, you're different people. The love was real â€” but the people outgrew it.

buildup.text: Personality changes significantly between ages 20 and 40. The person you married may literally become someone new.

discovery.text: A 20-year study found that couples who grow in similar directions stay together; divergent growth predicts divorce.

twist.text: Growing apart isn't failure. It's proof that both people were brave enough to keep evolving.

climax.text: Some love stories have natural endings. Honoring that is harder â€” and more mature â€” than staying out of fear.

punchline.text: Growing apart isn't failure. It's two people still evolving.
